line_1: No Pruning-knives our fertile Branches teaze,
line_2: While yours must grow but as their Masters please.

line_1: Convinc'd she no more can coquet it and teaze,
line_2: Instead of tormenting — she studies to please:

line_1: "Angry I growl'd, — My spirit cease to tease,
line_2: " Name it yourselves, — Cain, Judas, if you please;

line_1: Still at a loss, I do not wish to teaze; —
line_2: My muse, assist me — teach me how to please —

line_1: When most good-natur'd, aiming how to teaze:
line_2: Of rest impatient, yet in love with ease;

line_1: Still in one key, the Nightingale would teize:
line_2: Still in one key, not BRENT would always please.

line_1: Who with sad prayers the weary doctor tease,
line_2: To name the nameless ever-new disease;

line_1: She, proud to rule, yet strangely fram'd to teize,
line_2: Neglects his Offers while her Airs she plays,

line_1: And, like a lover, learns to teaze;
line_2: O'er all her neck and bosom strays,

line_1: When drams prove vain, and cholics teaze,
line_2: To me they fly for certain ease.
